navigate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to find which way you need to go when you are travelling from one place to another
navigate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: I’ll drive, you take the map and navigate.
Early explorers used to navigate by the stars.
We managed to navigate our way through the forest.
navigate.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to understand or deal with something complicated
navigate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: A solicitor will help you navigate the complex legal system.
I am currently trying to navigate through a whole stack of information on the subject.
navigate.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to sail along a river or other area of water
navigate.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The river is too dangerous to navigate.
navigate.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to find your way around on a particular website, or to move from one website to another
navigate.translation[0].definitions[3].e: The magazine’s website is easy to navigate.
navigate.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to find your way around on a particular website, or to move from one website to another
navigate.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The magazine’s website is easy to navigate.
